Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an interface to the Internet MiniChess Server.

    See the MiniChess Page for information. The basic workflow is to create a client object connected to the server, use the offer() or accept() method to start a game on that client, and then use the getMove() and sendMove() methods to play the game.

    A lower-level "expect/send" interface is also provided for those who want to extend the functionality of this class.

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String server,
      java.lang.String portStr,
      java.lang.String username,
      java.lang.String password)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new client connected to IMCS and logged on.
        Parameters:
        server - hostname or IP address of IMCS server, usually "imcs.svcs.cs.pdx.edu"
        portStr - server port number string, usually "3589"
        username - username of account on IMCS server
        password - password of account on IMCS server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • Client

      java.lang.String portStr,
      java.lang.String username,
      java.lang.String password,
      java.lang.String sendLineEnding)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new client connected to IMCS and logged on.
        Parameters:
        server - hostname or IP address of IMCS server, usually "imcs.svcs.cs.pdx.edu"
        portStr - server port number string, usually "3589"
        username - username of account on IMCS server
        password - password of account on IMCS server
        sendLineEnding - what to use for line ending when sending
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • expect

        public java.lang.String expect(java.lang.String code,
                      boolean verbose)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Get a response from the server. Blocks until response is received. Fails if the response code received does not match the response code accepted.
        Parameters:
        code - expected code
        verbose - if true, print the command sent on stdout
        Returns:
        response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • offer

        public char offer(char color)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Instruct the server to offer a game to other players. If color is "?", allow the other side or the server to pick the color. Blocks until the offer is accepted.
        Parameters:
        color - the color your side wants to play
        Returns:
        the color that your side should play
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • accept

        public char accept(java.lang.String id,
          char color)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Instruct the server to accept a game. If color is "?", allow the other side or the server to pick the color.
        Parameters:
        id - game id number string
        color - the color that your side wants to play
        Returns:
        the color that your side should play
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the connection to the server. Do not use the object after this.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
